alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 02 at 1:16PM PDT until September 02 at 3:30PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern San Bernardino County in southern California... * Until 330 PM PDT. * At 116 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across central San Bernardino County. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. State Route 127 had substantial impacts yesterday from rain, which has resulted in antecedent conditions conducive for additional flash flooding today. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Irwin, Baker, Daggett, Afton Canyon Campground, Dumont Dunes, State Route 127 Near Dumont Dunes and Newberry Springs. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
